VII.i.1.C.2.c
.
Rating Decisions That Render a Veteran Eligible for Additional Compensation for Dependents
When entitlement to additional compensation for a dependent(s) is granted concurrent with promulgation of a rating decision that assigns an overall SC disability evaluation of at least 30 percent to a Veteran whose overall SC disability evaluation
prior
to the rating decision was
less
than 30 percent (as described in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.C.1.b
), the effective date is the
later
of the following dates:
effective date of the overall SC disability evaluation of at least 30 percent, or
date shown in the
table
in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.C.2.d
.
Notes
:
The policy expressed in the preceding paragraph is also for application when entitlement to additional compensation for a dependent(s) is granted based on a claim that was pending when the rating decision referenced in
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 1.C.1.b
, was promulgated.
See
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.A.2.b
, for an explanation of the difference between the effective date of
entitlement
and the effective date of
payment
.
Reference
:Â  For more information on the effective date of entitlement to additional benefits for dependents, see
38 CFR 3.401(b)
.
